title: Feature Request: Launch saved RDP sessions using external tools
author: Sqwrly
body_snippet:
<!-- Feature Request -->
<!-- If you file a feature request, please delete the bug section -->

This is a feature request to allow saved RDP sessions to be launched with external tools. I'm not a developer so I don't know the best way to go about it. Maybe command line options or an API etc. As an example of what I would like to accomplish would be WoX launcher starting saved kitty/putty connections. This could possibly be related to this issue: https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/issues/5...

iterations.description: Already implemented in v1.79.0 via PR #3123 which added the %PROTOCOL% external tool token, and v1.80.0 via PR #3105/#2046 which added %PUTTYSESSION% token - external tools can now launch saved RDP sessions using protocol-aware tokens

comments.author: Karuczka
comments.snippet: It would be a grate function. A simple command line option could help for us.

notes:
AI triage: Already implemented in v1.79.0 via PR #3123 which added the %PROTOCOL% external tool token, and v1.80.0 via PR #3105/#2046 which added %PUTTYSESSION% token - external tools can now launch saved RDP sessions using protocol-aware tokens
Approach: Already resolved - external tools now support %PROTOCOL% and %PUTTYSESSION% tokens that enable launching saved sessions via external tools
